name: Cape Town 'native' tour - a cultural tour of the city and surrounds focusing on the mixed history of its many peoples.
description: The tour focuses on the rich yet not well known history of the peoples of 'mixed race' of Cape Town and visits major well-known sites as well as sites that give insight into this 'other' history - a local, Black (brown, coloured) history. It also passes through the city as experienced by the 'working class'. We see elements of what some call a divided city, a gritty and real city, a slowly Africanising city. A different tour that is safe, informative and pleasant. The tour is a walking one and depending on your energy, can be between 2 - 6 hours, tailor-made to suit the guests. It can include a coffee on the go at any of the many world-class barista establishments and  even a light meal at any of the street-food establishments as the city is awash with sophisticated eateries serving haute cuisine close to establishments dishing out artery clogging fries and grills.
